intro: Trachelium jacquinii subsp. dalgiciorum, commonly known as the Dalgan trachelium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with five lobes, and bloom in summer. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
